citation.name: Science
citation.title: HARP is an ATP-driven annealing helicase.

reference.scope: CHARACTERIZATION OF VARIANTS SIOD TRP-586 AND GLN-764

comment.text: ATP-dependent annealing helicase that binds selectively to fork DNA relative to ssDNA or dsDNA and catalyzes the rewinding of the stably unwound DNA. Rewinds single-stranded DNA bubbles that are stably bound by replication protein A (RPA). Acts throughout the genome to reanneal stably unwound DNA, performing the opposite reaction of many enzymes, such as helicases and polymerases, that unwind DNA. May play an important role in DNA damage response by acting at stalled replication forks.
Interacts with RPA2; the interaction is direct and mediates the recruitment by the RPA complex of SMARCAL1 to sites of DNA damage.
Ubiquitously expressed, with high levels in testis.
DNA damage-regulated phosphorylation by kinases that may include ATM, ATR and PRKDC.

disease.name: Schimke immuno-osseous dysplasia
disease.description: An autosomal recessive pleiotropic disorder characterized by spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia, renal dysfunction and immunodeficiency. Arteriosclerosis may also occur in some case.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the SNF2/RAD54 helicase family. SMARCAL1 subfamily.

property.value: P:cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
P:regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter

feature.description: SWI/SNF-related matrix-associated actin-dependent regulator of chromatin subfamily A-like protein 1
In a breast cancer sample; somatic mutation.
In SIOD; impairs without abolishing annealing helicase activity; no effect on specific binding to fork DNA; no effect on recruitment to sites of DNA damage; dbSNP:rs119473038.
In SIOD; abolishes annealing helicase activity; no effect on specific binding to fork DNA; no effect on recruitment to sites of DNA damage; dbSNP:rs267607071.
Loss of interaction with RPA2 and impaired recruitment by the RPA complex to sites of DNA damage.
